item.title: Reminiscence of the Olden Days
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: Kyle Train Depot and Heritage Center offers a wealth of historical knowledge, and should be a very tempting venue for history enthusiasts.

item.title: Baby Shower Photoshoot
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: Sachi and Saurav are expecting their first baby and are excited for her arrival. This is their second baby bump photoshoot with me. I am honored to be documenting this special milestone with them.

item.title: Baby Raynav
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
Raynav’s first photoshoot, along with his proud parents.

Turns out photographing a baby is difficult, as the expressions and poses cannot be controlled. The only control you generally have is the lighting and positioning the baby.

item.title: A Beginning Of Something New
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
Sachi and Saurav are expecting their first baby in July 2017!

I am sure we will be shooting a lot more pregnancy pictures as the day comes closer.

item.title: And Then There Were Three
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: Shriti and Naresh are expecting their first child in March. They wanted me to take some pictures to document their pregnancy. We wanted to go to a park to take these pictures but, Austin’s erratic winter weather put damper on our plans and we had to postpone few times.

item.title: Serious Maicha
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
Maicha is a Newari word, which means a young girl.

Saisha was gifted this beautiful traditional Newari costume by her maternal grandmother’s friend, back in May. She wore this costume for her daycare’s United Nation’s day celebration. However, we took advantage of the long Thanksgiving weekend to take Saisha’s pictures in this attire.

item.title: Magic, Ghosts, Goblins and Potent Brew
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: Sudixa and I have been talking about a witch flying on a broom theme for a long time. I am glad we were finally able to shoot the theme just in time for Halloween.

item.title: Levitation
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
My first try on levitation photography can be seen on this part of the post. Editing was not as hard as I thought it would be. Good results can be achieved with simple editing with Photoshop.

Thank you Rebecca and Brendan for coming fully prepared for the photo-shoot. It is always a pleasure working with ya’all.

item.title: Moving Ahead
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
Congratulations to Sachi for graduating from Texas A&M with Masters in Accounting.

Among my photograph subjects you are one of those who has always supported my efforts — enthusiastically.

item.title: The Bliss
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
My friends Sachi and Saurav have been happily married for four years, and still going strong. They are always willing to help me learn and test new ideas, for which I am grateful.

The shots taken below used a simple three lights setup, with the third acting as a background light.

item.title: Flow Posing
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
First time I heard of flow posing was while I watching Sue Bryce’s Glamour Photography on CreativeLive.

I understood the advantage of flow posing, but it took me time to incorporate into the work flow.

item.title: Two Lights Setup Outdoor
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: Using a second strobe as a rim light will separate the subject from a background. Separation is especially useful if the background is dark, or while shooting at night.

item.title: Fireworks
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: I was very excited about shooting fireworks this Independence Day. With an hour of research, I came up a list you might want to consider while shooting fireworks.

item.title: One Light Setup Indoor
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: This is the continuation of my previous blog. Here, I also use a single strobe to take a portrait. But, this time its an indoor portrait of my beautiful wife Sudixa.

item.title: Hand Painted Backdrop
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: Recently, I have been salivating over Oliphant Studio’s backdrops. They are piece of art, and look good on portraits. However, they aren’t for everyone, as price ranges from couple to few a thousand dollars.

item.title: One Light Setup
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: While I was learning to shoot using pocket strobe, I was under the impression, as most people are, that more means better. Although, I knew about the concept of chiaroscuro (use of shadow and light in an art, used since the Renaissance period), this seemingly simple concept took a while to sink in.

item.title: Acro Yoga
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
Rebecca and Brendan are into acro yoga. As stated in my previous post, both of them have been practicing the art for few years, which is quite apparent in the pictures.

We were lucky enough to have a clear sky on a Saturday morning, which is getting very rare these days in Austin, Texas.

item.title: The Art of Posing
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: I bought my first DSLR five years ago, it was a Nikon D3000. Shooting in automatic mode was easy and intuitive, but the pictures weren’t that good.

item.title: Inner Peace
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description: My friend Rebbeca and her buddy Erika are into acro yoga. Both of them have been practicing the art for few years. They wanted me to shoot them practicing outdoors.

item.title: Nifty Fifty During Sunset
item.author: sakh1979@gmail.com (Sagun Khatri)
item.description:
I love shooting during sunset, it gives picture a magical look.

But, shooting in the dusk, especially with the sun in the background, comes with its own challenges. There are few ways to shoot around the constraints:
